text: Answer: (a) and (c) Solution: (@)True: After every 10ms process must be preempted so timer interrupt is required. (b)False: It is preempted scheduling policy because after 10ms cpu is taken and assigned to other ready process. (0)True: Involuntary context switching mean process has not completed but has to leave the CPU. (d)False: The OS moves on to the next ready process in the list of processes in a round-robin fashion, so it not prioritizes process on the basis of CPU burst.
